title: Standalone vs Integrated Webhooks
body_html:
Standalone vs Integrated Webhooks

Summary

Huly supports a standalone webhook service today. This page compares it with a proposed integrated plugin approach.

Standalone Service (Current)

  • Separate microservice listening to MongoDB Change Streams
  • Pros:
    • Isolated deployment; no changes to Huly core
    • Mature retry/monitoring
  • Cons:
    • No access to Huly internals (permissions, business logic)
    • Requires replica set & separate operations
    • Event derivation from DB deltas can drift from business semantics

Integrated Plugin (Proposed)

  • Native trigger-based event creation inside Huly
  • Pros:
    • Uses transaction semantics; accurate event types
    • Access to hierarchy, permissions, and models
    • Unified logging/monitoring/security
  • Cons:
    • Requires work in core plugin system
    • Needs careful performance and isolation

Recommendation

  • Implement the integrated plugin in phases while keeping the standalone service available as a fallback/migration path.
